channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2022 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Videos show Russian units and missiles advancing toward Ukraine border
A world on edge awaits Putin's critical move
item.description: The world is suspended in an extraordinary moment of geopolitical limbo, on edge for a possible Russian invasion of Ukraine amid conflicting signals in Moscow, confusion in Kyiv and dire warnings from Washington.

item.title: Social media videos capture latest Russian military deployment near Ukraine
item.description: Amid the rising Russia-Ukraine tensions, social media posts captured by amateur videographers in Russia are helping shed light on Moscow's military mobilization toward the border with Ukraine. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

item.title: 'Dramatic acceleration' of Russian buildup prompts US to close Kyiv embassy
Russian skater Kamila Valieva carries weight of doping scandal onto ice
Day 11 of the Beijing Olympics
Djokovic says he'd skip French Open and Wimbledon due to vaccine stance
item.description: In an on-camera interview with the BBC, world No. 1 Novak Djokovic said he is willing to skip playing in the French Open or Wimbledon because of his vaccination stance.

item.title: South Korea fumes over cultural appropriation and 'biased judgments' at Beijing 2022
item.description: South Korea may have clinched its first gold medal at Beijing 2022 last week, but the success came amid tensions with China over alleged cultural appropriation and "biased judgments" during the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Canadian officials move to block funding of protests against Covid-19 rules
Ottawa resident and protester squabble during CNN reporter's interview
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has issued his most aggressive response yet to the so-called "Freedom Convoy" protests, invoking the government's Emergencies Act for the first time to try to end more than two weeks of blockades and demonstrations. The law can temporarily suspend people's freedom of movement or assembly and allows authorities to go after those who financially support the protests. CNN's Paula Newton has more.

item.title: Navy nuclear engineer pleads guilty to conspiracy to sell US naval secrets to foreign country
item.description: US Navy nuclear engineer Jonathan Toebbe pleaded guilty to one felony count in federal court Monday afternoon, four months after he and his wife were arrested and charged with trying to sell classified information about nuclear submarines to a foreign country in exchange for millions of dollars of cryptocurrency.

item.title: Trump Org's accounting firm says 10 years of financial statements are unreliable
George Conway explains why he thinks this is worse than impeachment
item.description: CNN's John Berman and George Conway discuss possible implications of former President Donald Trump's long-time accounting firm informing the Trump Organization that it should no longer rely on nearly 10 years' worth of financial statements and that they would no longer be their accountants, citing a conflict of interest.

item.title: Origin of rocket on course to slam into moon wrongly identified
item.description: A rogue rocket expected to collide with the moon on March 4 was wrongly identified as a SpaceX Falcon rocket stage and, instead, is likely from a past Chinese lunar mission, according to NASA.

item.title: US West's megadrought is the worst in 1,200 years
item.description: The West is in its worst drought in centuries, scientists reported Monday.

item.title: Pastor baptized people for decades using one wrong word. Now those are all considered invalid
item.description: A Catholic priest has resigned after a church investigation found he performed invalid baptisms throughout most of his more than 20-year career, according to Bishop Thomas Olmsted of the Diocese of Phoenix.

item.title: Hollywood actor sentenced to 20 years for mutlimillion dollar Ponzi scheme
item.description: Zachary Horwitz, a small-time actor who admitted to operating a multi-million dollar Ponzi scheme, was sentenced to 20 years in federal prison on Monday.

item.title: Elon Musk has donated $5.7 billion in Tesla shares to charity
item.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has donated roughly $5.7 billion worth of the electric carmaker's shares to charity.

item.title: White House to unveil multi-pronged approach to reduce emissions in the manufacturing sector
item.description: The White House will unveil new efforts to reduce emissions in the manufacturing sector Tuesday, including nearly $10 billion in Department of Energy funding from President Joe Biden's signature infrastructure law aimed at "clean hydrogen" manufacturing.

item.title: Louisiana man jailed for 44 years on rape charges is freed
item.description: Vincent Simmons, a Louisiana man who fought for 44 years to overturn his conviction on attempted aggravated rape charges, has had the judgment vacated and the charges have been dismissed, according to his attorneys Justin Bonus and Malcolm Larvadain.

item.title: Ocasio-Cortez: 'Very real risk' US will not be a democracy in 10 years
item.description: In an interview with David Remnick of "The New Yorker," Rep. Alexandria-Ocasio Cortez (D-NY) says there's a "very real risk" the United States will not still be a democracy in a decade. Don Lemon and CNN Senior Political Analyst Ron Brownstein discuss.

item.title: Eating raw cookie dough is your choice, but it has nothing to do with Covid precautions
item.description: Here we go again: Covid-19 cases are falling in nearly every state, spring is in the air and everyone is getting restless. Some have even gone so far as to let us know they are done with the pandemic or at least ready to move away from the problem.

item.title: Suspect arrested after an Albuquerque stabbing spree that left 11 people wounded
item.description: At least 11 people were stabbed Sunday in Albuquerque, New Mexico -- and police believe the same suspect was responsible for each attack.

item.title: Court frees brother who confessed to killing social media star Qandeel Baloch
item.description: The brother of murdered social media star Qandeel Baloch has been freed by a Pakistan appeals court, three years after he was convicted of killing her for "bringing dishonor" to the family.

item.title: A skier slid hundreds of feet and off a 50-foot cliff during an avalanche. He survived
item.description: A Colorado skier survived an avalanche that threw him off a 50-foot cliff and sent him sliding hundreds of feet.

item.title: Judge in Sarah Palin's defamation suit against New York Times says he will dismiss case
item.description: Judge Jed Rakoff, the judge overseeing former Alaska Gov. Sarah Palin's defamation lawsuit against the New York Times, said Monday afternoon that he will dismiss the suit, ruling that Palin's team did not prove a key element of its case.

item.title: Mom and child escape burning car moments before it goes up in flames
item.description: Spring, Texas, officials say a woman didn't realize her car was on fire until she saw smoke coming from her air vents. Video shows the car driving for nearly a mile before pulling over. The woman and her child managed to escape moments before the car was engulfed in flames. CNN affiliate KHOU has more.

item.title: US Coast Guard searches for downed airplane with 8 people
item.description: One body was recovered as the US Coast Guard searches for an airplane believed to have gone down about four miles east of Drum Inlet, on North Carolina's Outer Banks, with eight people on board, CNN affiliate WITN reported, citing a sheriff.

item.title: Israeli nationalists clash with Palestinians over Jerusalem housing settlements
item.description: CNN's Andrew Carey reports on the tensions, that sometimes turn violent, between Israeli nationalists and Palestinian settlers over housing in Jerusalem.

item.title: Brian Laundrie, Gabby Petito's fiancé, died from a gunshot wound to the head, medical examiner says
item.description: The cause of death of Brian Laundrie, the fiancé of Gabby Petito whose disappearance caused a firestorm late last summer, was revealed Monday.

item.title: The surprising way Rome could help prevent future pandemics
item.description: Modern cities spew out a constant surge of sewage but floating in the smelly sludge are vital cellular clues about Covid-19 and its spread among the population.

item.title: Canada-born slider wins gold for US after ​filing harassment complaint
item.description: Canada-born Kaillie Humphries​, winner of the first-ever Olympic gold in the monobob, says she "never gave up" on herself.

item.title: Hundreds of birds suddenly drop from the sky
item.description: Nearly 100 migratory birds were found after dropping mid-flight in Chihuahua, Mexico. Local authorities haven't confirmed what caused the birds' sudden death, Reuters reports.

item.title: Europe's new train routes for 2022
item.description: What's the perfect accompaniment to Europe's gradual easing of its pandemic rules? A burgeoning international rail network for 2022.

item.title: How 'Amapiano', South Africa's soulful sound, has become one of the hottest new music genres
item.description: A distinct sound is currently vibing on social feeds around the world: the deep house, log-drum driven basslines and soulful piano melodies of "Amapiano." While Amapiano dance challenges are currently sweeping TikTok, the streets of South Africa have been thrumming with its sound for years.

item.title: AirAsia flight in Malaysia rerouted after snake found on board plane
item.description: An AirAsia flight in Malaysia was re-routed after a snake was found on the plane, the airline has confirmed.

item.title: They met on Valentine's Day while hiking in the Himalayas
Celebrate yourself this day after Valentine's Day
item.description: Hold the flowers and the chocolates and the sappy love poems. Forget Valentine's Day and Galentine's Day and the pressure to make plans and buy things and give unto others.

item.title: Mary J. Blige wows Super Bowl halftime show
item.description: Mary J. Blige dazzled fans at the Super Bowl on Sunday evening, taking the stage in a bodysuit embellished with 10,000 Swarovski crystals.

item.title: Popular Super Bowl ad crashes system
item.description: Humans cheer and dogs bark at one weird Super Bowl ad that was so popular it crashed the advertiser's website. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: Carlos Ortiz 'nailed on the back with a beer can' at Phoenix Open
item.description: Carlos Ortiz says he was "nailed pretty hard on the back with a beer can," which had been thrown from the fans in celebration after he hit a hole-in-one at TPC Scottsdale in Arizona during the Phoenix Open.

item.title: Coinbase's strange QR-code Super Bowl ad briefly crashes app
item.description: The app for Coinbase, a cryptocurrency exchange, briefly crashed Sunday after a bizarre Super Bowl ad sparked a surge in traffic.

item.title: Tracing DNA of related elephants reveals illegal ivory trafficking networks
item.description: African elephants have drastically dwindled as targets of the illegal ivory trade, but the DNA contained within their tusks is pointing to the very criminal networks that poached them.

item.title: Newly discovered crocodile species ate a young dinosaur for its last meal, scientists say
item.description: A new species of crocodile dating back to the Cretaceous period has been discovered in Queensland, Australia, and its last meal was a young dinosaur, scientists say.

item.title: Here's who won gold medals at the Beijing Olympics on Monday
item.description: There were four gold medals up for grabs on Monday at the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics.

item.title: 'I am back!': Whoopi Goldberg returned to 'The View'
item.description: Whoopi Goldberg returned to "The View" after her two-week suspension because of her controversial comments on the Holocaust.

item.title: Rare notebook containing handwritten 'Hey Jude' lyrics to go on display
item.description: A rare notebook featuring handwritten lyrics and recording notes from hit songs by The Beatles is set to go on display at a museum in Liverpool, England.

item.title: From submarines and amphibious landing ships to ballistic missiles and tanks, the build-up of Russian forces continues apace
item.description: The build-up of Russian forces close to the Ukrainian border continues apace, with everything from submarines and amphibious landing ships in the Black Sea to short-range ballistic missiles, tanks and howitzers around Ukraine's northeastern edges.

item.title: If Russia invades, global stock markets could be in for a rough ride
item.description: If Russia invades Ukraine, global stock markets could be in for a rough ride — much worse than most other geopolitical events of the past several decades.

item.title: Opinion: Putin could turn off Europe's gas tap. This is the solution
item.description: As Russian troops remain camped across several of Ukraine's frontiers, Europe and the United States are scrambling to prevent an incursion, with a flurry of diplomatic efforts and by bolstering their own troops in nearby NATO countries.
